definition: to treat sb unfairly
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to stay

sentences.english: I think that's why there are only isolated cases of dismissals or ill treatment towards Filipinos.
sentences.chinese: 我想这为只雇和亏待菲律宾人的事件。

sentences.english: Romans often made resolutions to ask for forgiveness from a person they had wronged.
sentences.chinese: 当时罗马人常下决心要请曾被他们亏待的人原谅他们。

sentences.english: Trinity had never been unkind to me.
sentences.chinese: 三一学院从未亏待过我。

sentences.english: Maltreat what, don't also maltreat oneself.
sentences.chinese: 亏待什么，也别亏待了自己。

sentences.english: Maltreat what, don't also maltreat oneself.
sentences.chinese: 亏待什么，也别亏待了自己。

sentences.english: Christ mentioned this when pointing out what they had done to the commandment regarding parents (v. 9).
sentences.chinese: 基督指出他们如何亏待父母，就是一个明确的事例。
放心吧，我不会亏待你的。

sentences.english: She always grumbles to me about how badly treated at work.
sentences.chinese: 她总是向我抱怨她在工作中如何被亏待。

sentences.english: The UK citizens still appear to be being short-changed.
sentences.chinese: 英国市民似乎仍然在受到亏待。

definition: mean treatment/indifference/meager hospitality
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
generous treatment
to slight (treat badly)
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
to repay/to requite
to decline (an appointment, invitation etc)
stingy/mean/miserly
to blame
to show filial respect/to give presents (to one's elders or superiors)/to support one's aged parents
not to let sb down/to treat sb fairly/be worthy of
to do as promised/to be as good as one's word/to honor one's word/to mean what one says
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
with all of one's heart
to show respect for/to think highly of
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
